intro: Dimerostemma tenuifolium, commonly known as the slender-leaf dimerostemma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
